channel.title: W3C Web Events Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Web Events Working Group

item.title: [touch-events] Added explanation of touchcancel to "TouchEvent: changedTouches
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/changedTouches

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

No response

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

For the touchend event, it is a list of the touch points that have been removed from the surface (that is, the set of touch points corresponding to fingers no longer touching the surface).

What did you expect to see?

For the touchend and touchcancel events, it is a list of the touch points that have been removed from the surface (that is, the set of touch points corresponding to fingers no longer touching the surface).

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

https://w3c.github.io/touch-events/#dom-touchevent-changedtouches

Do you have anything more you want to share?

transfar from mdn/translated-content#22718
